title: (x) Australian GM - custom type {Mark S}
content:
This is a badge on the back of my car... I've seen a few similarities with other fonts, nothing exceptionally close though... (Autotechnica for one)... it's on the back of many GM cars in Australia, ranging from 1987-1997 (possibly later), I've seen about 6 different models, all with the same lettering... I'm hoping it wasn't made exclusively for them, but god knows... here is the image... any help would be greatly appreciated,

<img>
Thanks guys, and Cheers, Glen.
author: athrak

comments.content:
ok, well, i killed that post. i guess the Enable HTML code in message doesn't actually work. :/ ![Camira-small](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110140910im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/39306.jpg)   
   
I guess i should of done that to begin with, heh. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110140910im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
Thanks, Glen.

Auto makers have always had people in-house who design the nameplates. They are sometimes based on fonts, but more often, they are custom-designed. That said, there may well be a font that looks something like this, but I think it's unlikely that they used a font to create this particular nameplate.

Thanks for the post. I was dreading that it was a custom creation, but if anyone could give suggestions on a similar design, I'd be more than greatful.   
   
there are about 6-7 models of car, with this lettering on each, so i guess it could come down to scanning the badges, and creating a font out of it. while I don't have access to all of the letters, I have most, so i guess it's better than nothing.   
   
Cheers,   
Glen.

I started searching with the word 'Techno' at MyFonts.com. Here's the first close one, [SB Vibe](http://web.archive.org/web/20051110140910/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/selfbuildtype/sb-vibe/bold/testdrive.html?s=CAMIRA&p=48).   
There are probably more, because this kind of squared Bauhaus-look is very popular.
